content: pumpkin felted trick-or-treat bag material yarn choices please choose one drops snow 55 yards 50 meters 50 grams 1 76 once 4 balls col a copper 86 orange 1 ball col b apple green 29 green berroco ultra alpaca chunky 120 meters 131 yards 100 grams 3 53 once 2 skeins col a orange 1 skein col b light green or leaf green berroco ultra alpaca worsted 200 meters 219 yards 100 grams 3 5 once held double in slightly different colors for marled effect 2 skeins deep orange col a tiger s eye mix or candied yam mix 2 skeins light orange col aa grove mix or melon mix 1 skein dark green col b 1 skein light green col bb note if you don t want the marled effect on the leaves 1 green skein separated in parts will be enough if you don t want the marled effect on the body you will still need close to 4 skeins in orange or any super bulky 5-6 wpi or bulky 7 wpi that is not machine washable gauge 11 stitches and 15 rounds = 10 cm 4 in stockinette stitch note that the gauge is not important you should have a very loose knit fabric when the project comes off the needle but it will get its shape in the felting process needles one set 7 mm dpns 9 mm circular 40 cm and 80 cm you can use only the 80 cm needle if using magic loop technique marker one for bor other small closable mesh bag for felting optional the mesh bags that are used for washing bathing suits are usually perfect some wool wash can be added at the felting step note this pumpkin-shaped bag is knit in the round from the bottom up the border and handles are knit from stitches picked up on the brim and the decorative leaves are knit separately the bag and the leaves are then felted and decorative leaves are sewn to the bag later instructions bag with 7 mm dpns and col a orange co 8 st join in the round placing bor marker
